titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to impose excise taxes on acts of self-dealing and private inurement by certain tax-exempt organizations.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E3057-3058)

bill.summary: 11/22/1993--Introduced. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to impose an excise tax on: (1) each act of self-dealing between a disqualified person and a tax-exempt organization; and (2) any direct or indirect inurement of net earnings of a tax-exempt organization to the benefit of any disqualified person. Describes a disqualified person as: (1) any organization manager; (2) any family member of an organization manager; or (3) any 35-percent controlled entity of such persons.
